author: Staff Reporter
text:
Persons from various political parties, who were imprisoned under Maintenance of Internal Security Act (MISA) on January 31, 1976, during the emergency period, shared memories at the reunion organised at the Coimbatore Press Club on Sunday.

Arrested

Around 500 persons from across the State were arrested under MISA.

“Forty-five of them from seven political parties and organisations were arrested and lodged in Coimbatore Central Prison. Only 13 of them are alive,” says general secretary of Thanthai Periyar Dravida Kazhagam (TPDK) K. Ramakrishnan who is among those arrested under the Act.

Eight of the detenus and families of those who are no more took part in the reunion.

“The Union Government is trying to forcibly bring in reforms against the interest of people. Those at the centre should not forget that many RSS cadre were arrested under MISA for taking a stand against the then government’s anti-democratic policies,” Mr. Ramakrishnan said.

Former Union Minister M. Kannappan of Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) said that he was proud to be among those arrested under MISA for raising their voice to protect democracy. Babu from the Communist Party of India - Marxist (CPIM) said that the one year they spent together in jail helped the prisoners live in unity despite their varied political ideologies.
title: MISA prisoners share memories in reunion
